16:	    def post(self, url, data, verify=False):
17:	        self._logger.log('%s: %s' %(url, data))
18:	        return requests.post(url=url, data=data, headers=self.headers, verify=verify)

16:	    def post(self, url, data, verify=False):
17:	        self._logger.log('%s: %s' %(url, data))
18:	        return requests.post(url=url, data=data, headers=self.headers, verify=verify)

49:	    def create(self, name=None, container=None, attributes=None):
50:	        if not name:
51:	            if not self.name:
52:	                raise AssertionError('Must supply a name property.')
53:	            name = self.name
54:	        if not container:
55:	            if not self.container:
56:	                raise AssertionError('Must supply a container property.')
57:	            container = self.container
58:	        if not attributes:
59:	            if self.attributes:
60:	                if not isinstance(attributes, list):
61:	                    raise TypeError('Attributes must be a list.')
62:	                attributes = self.attributes
63:	
64:	        dn = container + '\\' + name
65:	
66:	        self._logger.log('Creating policy with DN "%s".' % dn)
67:	        if self.api.preference == ApiPreferences.websdk:
68:	            policy = self.api.websdk.Config.Create.post(dn, ConfigClass.policy, attributes or []).object
69:	        elif self.api.preference == ApiPreferences.aperture:
70:	            policy = self.api.aperture.ConfigObjects.Policies.post(name, container).object
71:	        else:
72:	            raise FeatureError.invalid_api_preference(self.api.preference)
73:	
74:	        self.load(policy)
75:	        if self.dn:
76:	            self._logger.log('Folder DN is %s.' % self.dn)
77:	        else:
78:	            raise ValueError('DN not created as expected.')
79:	
80:	        return self

16:	    def post(self, url, data, verify=False):
17:	        self._logger.log('%s: %s' %(url, data))
18:	        return requests.post(url=url, data=data, headers=self.headers, verify=verify)

40:	    def _validate(self):
41:	        self._validated = True
42:	
43:	        if not isinstance(self.response, Response):
44:	            raise TypeError("Expected response object, but got %s." % type(self.response))
45:	
46:	        if self.response.status_code not in self._valid_return_codes:
47:	            raise InvalidResponseError("Received %s, but expected one of %s. Error message is: %s" % (self.response.status_code, str(self._valid_return_codes), self.response.text))
48:	
49:	        self.logger.log('Response to %s is valid. Got %s.' %(self._url, self.response.status_code))

43:	        if not isinstance(self.response, Response):
44:	            raise TypeError("Expected response object, but got %s." % type(self.response))
45:

22:	        @property
23:	        @response_property()
24:	        def result(self):
25:	            result = self.response.json().get('Result')
26:	            result = Credentials.Result(result)
27:	            if result.code != 1:
28:	                raise ValueError('Could not create credential. Received %s: %s.' % (result.code, result.credential_result))
29:	            self.logger.log('Credential object created successfully.')
30:	            return result

11:	    def create(self, name, folder, username, password):
12:	        """
13:	        :type name: str
14:	        :type folder: Folder
15:	        :type username: str
16:	        :type password: str
17:	        """
18:	        dn = folder.dn + "\\" + name
19:	
20:	        if self.api.preference == ApiPreferences.aperture:
21:	            self._logger.log(FeatureError.not_implemented(ApiPreferences.aperture).message)
22:	
23:	        result = self.api.websdk.Credentials.Create.post(
24:	            credential_path=dn,
25:	            friendly_name='UsernamePassword',
26:	            values=[
27:	                {'Name': 'Username', 'Type': 'string', 'Value': username},
28:	                {'Name': 'Password', 'Type': 'string', 'Value': password}
29:	            ]
30:	        ).result
31:	
32:	        self._logger.log('UsernamePassword credential "%s" created successfully.' % dn)
33:	
34:	        self.load()
35:	        return self

22:	    def run_test(self):
23:	        folder = Folder(self.auth)
24:	        folder.create('_%s_%s' % (self.auth.preference, self.timestamp), '\\VED\\Policy')
25:	
26:	        cred = UsernamePasswordCredential(self.auth)
27:	        cred.create(
28:	            name='_%s_credential' % self.auth.preference,
29:	            folder=folder,
30:	            username= 'tyler',
31:	            password='newPassw0rd!'
32:	        )
33:	        self.logger.log('Created credential!!')
